result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber Mariah Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF: Amber Mariah Rivera appeared from jail.  Court called.  Set for STC.  There is an agreement.  Crt orally reviews the plea questionnaire and informs the DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CM722
- DE sentenced to 15 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for 15 days time served and to run concurrent with 
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA surcharge
- Court orders the court costs and DNA surcharge to be reduced to a civil judgment
- 20 days to appeal
Status conference on November 7, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

*AMENDED*

- DE has until 5:00 p.m. 05/13/16 to provide an address to the Clerk of Court

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Phoebe or Clyde M..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

per Defendant in court. eif

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Phoebe or Clyde M. or their residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
